summary: Marcus Aurelius examines the nature of human faults, emphasizing honesty, clarity, and vigilance over the mind. He warns against self-deception, impulsive reactions, and moral compromise while urging constant refinement of thought and behavior. Book XI focuses on integrity, rational discipline, and recognizing the flaws that distort judgment.

micro_lessons.title: Recognize Your Own Faults First
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus warns against judging others before examining your own weaknesses.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What should you examine before judging others?

micro_lessons.title: Avoid Hypocrisy
micro_lessons.core_idea: Demanding virtue from others but not from yourself destroys integrity.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Because it destroys integrity and self-respect.

micro_lessons.title: Others' Faults Are Mirrors
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus teaches that the flaws you notice in others often reflect flaws within yourself.

micro_lessons.title: Interpret Actions With Charity
micro_lessons.core_idea: Give others the most generous reasonable interpretation whenever possible.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Because it prevents unnecessary anger and preserves harmony.

micro_lessons.title: Self-Deception Is the Greatest Danger
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus considers lying to yourself far more harmful than lying to others.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What does Marcus consider the greatest danger?

micro_lessons.title: Guard the Mind Against Corruption
micro_lessons.core_idea: The mind must be protected from harmful thoughts the same way you protect a city from invaders.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: How does Marcus describe protecting the mind?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Like guarding a city from invaders.

micro_lessons.title: Your Character Is Shaped by What You Tolerate
micro_lessons.core_idea: Allowing small vices makes room for greater ones.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What shapes your character over time?

micro_lessons.title: Do Not Imitate the Wicked
micro_lessons.core_idea: Even if others behave badly, you must maintain your own virtue.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What should you avoid even when surrounded by bad behavior?

micro_lessons.title: Keep Your Principles Clear
micro_lessons.core_idea: Acting without firm principles leads to confusion and inconsistency.

micro_lessons.title: Speak Only What Is True
micro_lessons.core_idea: Truth is essential to a stable mind; lies fracture the self.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Because lies fracture the mind and weaken integrity.

micro_lessons.title: Avoid Acting on Impulse
micro_lessons.core_idea: Impulse bypasses reason and leads to regret.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Because it bypasses reason and leads to mistakes.

micro_lessons.title: Stay Rooted in the Present
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus reminds himself to stay anchored in the current moment when the mind scatters.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What is the remedy for a scattered mind?

micro_lessons.title: Correct Error Without Shame
micro_lessons.core_idea: Correcting yourself is a sign of strength, not weakness.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What does correcting an error show?

micro_lessons.title: Avoid Being Ruled by Emotion
micro_lessons.core_idea: Strong emotions cloud reason and distort judgment.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: Why be cautious of strong emotions?

micro_lessons.title: Live Honestly and Transparently
micro_lessons.core_idea: Nothing to hide = nothing to fear.

micro_lessons.title: Resist Flattery and Manipulation
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus warns that praise can be a tool for others to control you.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Because it can manipulate your choices.

micro_lessons.title: Your Inner State Determines Your Outer Life
micro_lessons.core_idea: A chaotic mind creates a chaotic world; a calm mind creates clarity.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What shapes your experience of the world?

micro_lessons.title: Return to Reason Again and Again
micro_lessons.core_idea: Reason is the anchor that stabilizes the mind when emotions flare.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What stabilizes the mind during emotional storms?
